name: Machu Picchu
description: An ancient Incan city located in the Andes Mountains, known for its stunning architecture and dramatic landscape.

name: The Colosseum
description: A famous ancient amphitheater built during the Roman Empire, known for gladiator contests and other public spectacles.

name: The Great Wall of China
description: A series of fortifications built across northern China to protect against invasions, it spans over 13,000 miles.

name: Taj Mahal
description: A magnificent marble mausoleum built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.

name: Pyramids of Giza
description: An ancient complex of pyramids, including the Great Pyramid, built as tombs for the Pharaohs.

name: Angkor Wat
description: A stunning temple complex built in the 12th century, the largest religious monument in the world.

name: Petra
description: An ancient city carved into rose-red cliffs, once the capital of the Nabatean kingdom.

name: Acropolis of Athens
description: A hilltop citadel featuring ancient buildings such as the Parthenon, symbolizing the birthplace of democracy.

name: Stonehenge
description: A prehistoric monument consisting of a ring of massive stones, believed to have been constructed between 3000-2000 BC.

name: Alhambra
description: A breathtaking palace and fortress complex built during the Moorish rule in Spain.

name: Easter Island Moai Statues
description: A collection of large stone statues called Moai, created by the Rapa Nui people between 1400 and 1650 CE.

name: Versailles Palace
description: A magnificent royal château known for its opulent architecture, gardens, and historical significance.

name: Chichen Itza
description: An ancient Mayan city known for its impressive pyramid, El Castillo, and astronomical observatory.

name: Eiffel Tower
description: An iconic iron lattice tower and symbol of Paris, built as the entrance arch for the 1889 World's Fair.

name: Mesa Verde National Park
description: A well-preserved cliff dwelling complex built by the Ancestral Puebloans around 1200 CE.

name: Borobudur Temple
description: A massive Buddhist temple built in the 9th century, known for its intricate carvings and stupas.

name: Cologne Cathedral
description: A stunning Gothic cathedral known for its twin spires, UNESCO-listed as a masterpiece of human creative genius.

name: Meteora
description: A complex of rock formations topped with monasteries, dating back to the 14th century.

name: Göreme National Park and the Rock Sites of Cappadocia
description: A region with unique rock formations and underground cities carved by early Christians.

name: Pompeii
description: An ancient Roman city frozen in time by the eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD.

name: Forbidden City
description: An imperial palace complex that served as the home of Chinese emperors for nearly 500 years.

name: The Louvre
description: One of the world's largest and most visited museums, housed in a historic palace.

name: Sistine Chapel
description: The papal chapel in the Vatican Palace known for its stunning frescoes by Michelangelo.

name: The Alhambra
description: A breathtaking palace and fortress complex built during the Moorish rule in Spain.

name: Machu Picchu
description: An ancient Incan city located in the Andes Mountains, known for its stunning architecture.

name: Stone Town of Zanzibar
description: A historic city with intricate architecture and a fusion of African, Arab, Indian, and European cultures.

name: Mont-Saint-Michel
description: A stunning island commune with a medieval abbey perched atop a rocky island.

name: Hagia Sophia
description: An iconic former cathedral and mosque with a stunning dome and intricate mosaics.

name: Ephesus
description: An ancient Greek city famous for its well-preserved ruins, including the Library of Celsus.

name: Mesa Verde National Park
description: A well-preserved cliff dwelling complex built by the Ancestral Puebloans.

name: Borobudur Temple Compounds
description: A monumental Buddhist temple complex built in the 9th century, featuring elaborate carvings and stupas.

name: The Kremlin and Red Square
description: An iconic historic complex in Moscow featuring landmarks like the Kremlin, St. Basil's Cathedral, and Red Square.

name: Museum Island
description: An ensemble of five museums located on the Spree River, including the Pergamon Museum and the Altes Museum.

name: Historic Centre of Florence
description: The historic heart of Florence, featuring landmarks like the Florence Cathedral, Uffizi Gallery, and Ponte Vecchio.

name: Vatican City
description: An independent city-state within Rome, known for St. Peter's Basilica, Vatican Museums, and the Sistine Chapel.

name: Old City of Jerusalem and its Walls
description: A historic walled area containing key religious sites for Judaism, Christianity, and Islam, such as the Western Wall and Church of the Holy Sepulchre.

name: Budapest Castle Quarter
description: A historic castle complex overlooking the Danube River, featuring the Buda Castle and Matthias Church.

name: Museum of Islamic Art
description: A museum showcasing Islamic art collections from three continents, housed in a modernist building on the Doha Corniche.

name: Mingus Mill
location: Great Smoky Mountains National Park, USA
description: A historic grist mill built in 1886 and operated until the 1930s, showcasing traditional Appalachian craftsmanship.

name: Skellig Michael
description: An ancient monastic site on a rugged island, featuring stone beehive huts and a medieval monastery.

name: Museum of Modern Art (MoMA)
description: An influential museum dedicated to modern and contemporary art, with a diverse collection of paintings, sculptures, and more.

name: Tower of London
description: A historic castle and fortress on the River Thames, known for its role in English history and housing the Crown Jewels.

name: Palace of Versailles
description: A grand palace and former royal residence known for its opulent architecture, gardens, and Hall of Mirrors.

name: Ellora Caves
description: A complex of rock-cut temples and caves representing Buddhist, Hindu, and Jain cultures, dating from the 6th to 10th century.

name: Museo Nacional de Antropología
description: A renowned museum showcasing Mexico's diverse indigenous cultures, with artifacts ranging from pre-Columbian times to the present.

name: Giza Necropolis
description: An ancient Egyptian burial site containing the Great Pyramid of Giza, Sphinx, and other tombs and temples.

name: Himeji Castle
description: A stunning hilltop castle complex dating back to the 17th century, known for its white exterior and defensive structures.

name: Saint Basil's Cathedral
description: An iconic Russian Orthodox church with colorful onion domes, built to commemorate the capture of Kazan and Astrakhan.

name: Auschwitz-Birkenau Concentration Camp
description: A former Nazi concentration camp memorializing the victims of the Holocaust during World War II.

name: Ephesus
description: An ancient Greek city famous for its well-preserved ruins, including the Library of Celsus and the Temple of Artemis.

name: The Acropolis Museum
description: A museum dedicated to the findings of the archaeological site of the Acropolis of Athens.

name: Sainte-Chapelle
description: A Gothic chapel known for its stunning stained glass windows depicting biblical scenes.

name: Tomb of Seti I
description: The tomb of Seti I, a pharaoh of the 19th Dynasty of Egypt, known for its well-preserved wall paintings.

name: Palmyra
description: An ancient Semitic city known for its well-preserved ruins, including the Temple of Bel and the Arch of Triumph.

name: Mount Athos
description: An autonomous monastic state and UNESCO World Heritage Site, home to 20 Eastern Orthodox monasteries.

name: Melk Abbey
description: A Benedictine abbey overlooking the Danube River, known for its Baroque architecture and library.

name: Carthage
description: An ancient Phoenician city-state and later Roman empire, known for its ruins and historical significance.

name: Djemila
description: An ancient Roman town known for its well-preserved ruins, including temples, basilicas, and forums.

name: Wieliczka Salt Mine
description: A historic salt mine known for its underground chambers, chapels, and sculptures made of salt.

name: Orkney Islands
description: An archipelago off the northeastern coast of Scotland, known for its Neolithic and Viking archaeological sites.

name: Terracotta Army
description: A collection of life-sized terracotta sculptures depicting the armies of Qin Shi Huang, the first Emperor of China.

name: Carcassonne
description: A fortified medieval city in France, known for its well-preserved walls, towers, and historic buildings.

name: Monte Alban
description: An ancient Zapotec city atop a hill, featuring impressive ruins, pyramids, and tombs.

name: Brú na Bóinne
description: A complex of Neolithic chamber tombs, passage graves, and other ancient structures.

name: Potala Palace
description: A majestic palace complex perched on Marpo Ri hill, once the winter residence of the Dalai Lamas.

name: Blenheim Palace
description: A grand country house and UNESCO World Heritage Site, birthplace of Sir Winston Churchill.

name: Cinque Terre
description: A picturesque coastal area featuring five colorful villages clinging to cliffs along the Italian Riviera.

name: Nara Historic Monuments
description: A collection of ancient Japanese temples, shrines, and ruins, including Todai-ji and Kasuga Taisha.

name: Salisbury Cathedral
description: A magnificent Gothic cathedral known for its towering spire, clock, and historic Magna Carta.

name: Taos Pueblo
description: An ancient pueblo community continuously inhabited for over 1,000 years by the Taos Pueblo people.

name: Petra
description: An ancient city carved into rose-red cliffs, famous for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system.

name: Mausoleum at Halicarnassus
description: A monumental tomb built for Mausolus, a satrap of the Persian Empire, considered one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

name: Taj Mahal
description: A magnificent white marble mausoleum built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.

name: Great Wall of China
description: An ancient series of fortifications built to protect Chinese states and empires from invasions.

name: Bryggen
description: A series of historic Hanseatic buildings along the waterfront of Bergen, showcasing medieval architecture.

name: Lalibela
description: A town known for its rock-hewn churches, carved out of solid rock, dating back to the 12th and 13th centuries.

name: Persepolis
description: An ancient capital of the Achaemenid Empire, featuring impressive ceremonial palaces, gates, and sculptures.

name: Sagrada Familia
description: A breathtaking basilica designed by Antoni Gaudí, known for its intricate facades and stunning interior.

name: Machu Picchu
description: An ancient Incan city located in the Andes Mountains, known for its stunning architecture and scenic setting.

name: Angkor Wat
description: A vast temple complex built by the Khmer Empire, dedicated to the Hindu god Vishnu.
